statement.text: Complete Decongestive Therapy (CDT) is the gold standard treatment for lymphedema, consisting of two phases: an intensive reduction phase with manual lymphatic drainage (MLD), multilayer short-stretch bandaging, exercise, and skin care, followed by a maintenance phase with compression garments and self-management.
statement.formal: CDT = Phase_1(MLD + Bandaging + Exercise + Skincare) â†’ Phase_2(Compression_Garments + Self_MLD + Maintenance)

explanation.intuition: CDT works by manually pushing fluid out of the swollen limb toward working lymphatics, then preventing refill with compression. Phase 1 is intensive treatment by therapists to achieve maximum reduction; Phase 2 is lifelong maintenance by the patient to preserve gains.
explanation.key_insight: CDT achieves 40-60% volume reduction in compliant patients but requires lifelong maintenance. Success depends critically on patient adherence to Phase 2 - without maintenance compression, all gains are lost within months.
explanation.technical_details: Phase 1 (Intensive Reduction): Duration 2-4 weeks with daily sessions. MLD uses light pressure (30-40 mmHg) in specific sequences to redirect lymph through collateral pathways. Multilayer bandaging with short-stretch bandages provides high working pressure, low resting pressure. Exercises performed in bandages to enhance muscle pump. Meticulous skin care prevents cellulitis. Phase 2 (Maintenance): Fitted compression garments (Class II-III, 20-40 mmHg), self-MLD, continued exercise, skin hygiene. Night compression for severe cases. Contraindications include active cellulitis, DVT, decompensated CHF, and arterial insufficiency.

manual_lymph_drainage.technique: Light pressure (<40 mmHg) skin stretching in specific sequences
manual_lymph_drainage.mechanism: Stimulates lymphangion contractions, opens collateral pathways
manual_lymph_drainage.sequence: Proximal to distal clearing - treat trunk first, then proximal limb, then distal
manual_lymph_drainage.frequency: Daily in Phase 1, 2-3x weekly in maintenance

compression_bandaging.principle: High working pressure (with muscle activity), low resting pressure
compression_bandaging.layers: Skin protection, foam padding, multiple bandage layers

exercise.intensity: Low to moderate - avoid vigorous activity initially

skin_care.components: Daily washing, pH-balanced moisturizers, prompt wound care
skin_care.education: Recognition of cellulitis signs, early antibiotic initiation

phase_1.setting: Outpatient lymphedema clinic or specialized facility

phase_2.components: Fitted garments, self-MLD, exercise, skin care
phase_2.garments: Custom-fit Class II-III (20-40 mmHg), replaced every 4-6 months

outcomes.quality_of_life: Significant improvement in symptoms and function

definition.@value: The gold standard multicomponent treatment for lymphedema consisting of manual lymphatic drainage, compression therapy, exercise, and skin care in an intensive reduction phase followed by lifelong maintenance.

learning_objectives: Describe the components of Complete Decongestive Therapy
Understand the rationale for each CDT component
clinical_pearls: CDT achieves 40-60% volume reduction - it works if patients comply
Phase 2 maintenance is LIFELONG - gains lost without adherence
Short-stretch bandages provide HIGH working pressure, LOW resting pressure
Always treat PROXIMAL first (clear the way for distal drainage)
Each cellulitis episode worsens lymphedema - skin care is therapeutic
Contraindicated in active cellulitis - treat infection first
